bank_interface

Class HasNoAccount

  • java.lang.Object
    • bank_interface.HasNoAccount

  • public class HasNoAccount
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HasNoAccount(bank_interface.CustomerInterface customerInterface, bank_package.BankProxy newBankProxy)
      HasNoAccount creates the HasNoAccount state, used by the CustomerInterface class.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addAccount()
      not allowed in this state
      void enterPassword() 
      void enterUUID() 
      void hasAccount(boolean wantsToRegister)
      hasAccount This method asks the user whether they would like to register or not, accepting a non-case-sensitive yes for true and a non-case-sensitive no as false
      void logOff()
      saves current bank data, logs the user out of the system, and changes the state to LoggedOff

      not allowed in this state

      not allowed in this state

    • Constructor Detail

      • HasNoAccount

        public HasNoAccount(bank_interface.CustomerInterface customerInterface,
                    bank_package.BankProxy newBankProxy)
        HasNoAccount creates the HasNoAccount state, used by the CustomerInterface class. Represents the state during which the customer may choose to either register or log in under an existing profile
        Parameters:
        newBankProxy - BankProxy object passed from the CustomerInterface constructor. used to access customer specific data used for customer addition
        customerInterface - an instance of the customerInterface, used to set states when the state changes.

    • Method Detail

      • enterUUID

        public void enterUUID()

      • enterPassword

        public void enterPassword()

      • hasAccount

        public void hasAccount(boolean wantsToRegister)
        hasAccount This method asks the user whether they would like to register or not, accepting a non-case-sensitive yes for true and a non-case-sensitive no as false
        Parameters:
        wantsToRegister - boolean is false by default, only true if the user already stated they want to register, thereby avoiding asking them twice.

      • logOff

        public void logOff()
        saves current bank data, logs the user out of the system, and changes the state to LoggedOff

      • requestInformation

        public void requestInformation()
        not allowed in this state

      • startTransaction

        public void startTransaction()
        not allowed in this state

      • addAccount

        public void addAccount()
        not allowed in this state
